title: mRemoteNG from command line
author: Cool34000
body_snippet:
Is there a way to launch mRemoteNG from the command line and open a reccorded connection directly?
Or launch mRemoteNG with parameters to open a connection not registered in it?

comments.snippet: At the moment there is no way to launch a connection at the same time as opening mRemoteNG in the way you are asking. The only options available at the moment are: https://mremoteng.readthedocs.io/en/latest/command_line_switches.html
comments.author: nmat

comments.snippet: This was suggested back in Feb, only 1 extra thumbs up, is this a feature people need?  Is there a demand for it?  If there isn't, can we close the request?  If there is a demand, then I can work on it.
comments.author: lukeattard

comments.snippet: Technically don't sounds complicated to implement, just need wrapper to check on attributes on mRemoteNG start and if such found - run them (additional question for connection what are stored in db or protected with encrypted device) but at least first step can be just run connection by ip address, protocol, and port. If @lukeattard you want to try - go for it. Will be happy to approve.

comments.snippet:
I have checked the code, there is no cmd line args that would allow for a connection to be called from the cmd line, either a quick connect or a saved connection.

I dont believe there is a demand or a high need for this feature, I think dev time would be better spent on the other issues and I suggest we close this feature, or put it as low priority on the road map for later.
